changes: Content-visibility: auto on all below-fold sections â€” browser skips layout/paint for offscreen content, deferring hundreds of DOM elements until scroll reveals them
Particle pool for hero mouse trail â€” replaced per-mousemove DOM create/destroy (16 ops/sec) with a fixed pool of 16 reusable elements, eliminating GC pressure

changes.reasoning: Performance was last touched at iteration 112 (seven iterations ago) â€” the most overdue category. The page had grown to 8900+ lines with 20+ sections, each rendering eagerly regardless of viewport position. content-visibility: auto is the single highest-impact CSS property for long pages â€” it tells the browser to skip layout, paint, and style calculation for offscreen sections entirely. The mouse trail was creating and destroying DOM nodes at 20Hz, generating unnecessary garbage collection pressure. Pooling 16 particles and reusing them via index rotation eliminates all DOM churn. Both changes are invisible to visitors â€” the page simply feels faster.
